Open flames only exist on Earth, too!


Fire needs oxygen and a fuel to exist, and since, chemically, the oxygen in our atmosphere was freed up biologically, it could be that the Earth, the only Planet known to have life, is the ONLY place in the entire Universe with fire!

And since fire was so crucial to Human development, this could be the only Planet that has heavier elements separated from each other in abundance.

Like bronze, Iron, and steel, all of which were necessary for us to advance through the ages to being at the technological level that we're at now.

Typing on our tablets, in the steel frame constructed buildings, sending signals into space to be relayed by orbital satellites to the YouTube place to be added to the comments!

What you're doing right now wouldn't be possible anywhere else.

But what's REALLY a mind-blower is;

If there were no creatures living here on Earth, or anywhere else, with the five or so senses available to them allowing them to comprehend the Universe, would the Universe actually even exist!?!

If you were born blind deaf and dumb, with no taste buds and no smell receptors, and a non-functioning nervous system, so you couldn't touch or feel anything, would ANYTHING exist?!

Is there only a "reality," because we have a mass in our skull electrochemically interpreting the signals sent to it by all the other masses of meat that we're made of?!?

As for the heated up planet, we are giving a big hair cut to our world by chopping all the trees that help exchange the air and water for us to consume.  With the lack of trees for shading and more and more grey and black concrete cities evolving goes with the retention of heat.  Water reflects heat and light from above so we are just asking for it to stay hotter and burn us from both above and from inside too.

Makes sense because I always thought that we are slowly moving into the sun all of us.  Just enough to notice the heat and lack of water returning to the surface  of our planet every year.  Our rotation is where we spin a 24 hour period is still the same 24 hour spin but the bigger rotation Earth makes around the sun which is 365 (365 ish add the leap years and other corrections) is a very slightly perhaps shorter path of rotation to where we don't notice that the years are a tiny bit faster.  Does anyone recall that when you were a little kid and were excited about christmas or a day trip to a fun place, that those nights were very long?  Sure they took forever and maybe you had trouble sleeping?  Now as an adult there is not even enough time to sleep as the nights go flying by and never enough time in a day to do much of anything yet back when we were kids, days in school or playing in the yard were lengthy? We still have the same circles around the sun and same circles we make in our day as we turn about the sun. So everything appears to be relevant still but the heat each year and the feeling of the shorter or faster flying time.  Also with the weight of the water being removed from our surface the pull of the sun and moons gravity will pull harder on the land plates causing some uprising and more movement here is felt on the ground too.  Why not?
